results.deck: Crytek is a video game company, known for developing Far Cry, Crysis and the CryENGINE.
results.description:
Overview

Crytek is a German video game company founded in 1999 by three Turkish brothers: Cevat Yerli, Faruk Yerli and Avni Yerli. They started their company to create a competitive game-engine that would hold up to id Software's Quake-Engine and Epic's Unreal-Engine, who dominated the market at that time. In 2000, they presented a first tech-demo at the NVidia booth at the European Computer Trade Show in London. Thanks to the overwhelming feedback they continued to develop on the demo and eventually decided to create a full-blown

FPS which became FAR CRY. Crytek's main studio is in Frankfurt, Germany, but they also have many other big studios. Those are: Crytek Budapest, Crytek Kiev, Crytek Sofia, Crytek Seoul, Crytek Nottingham. World wide they have about 600 employees.

Crytek has many partnerships with game and computer companies. They have studios in 36 nations around the world. Those partnerships that deal with the gaming side of things are: EA, Ubisoft and Nvidia.

Awards

Over the years Crytek has won many awards for their games.

2009

Best PC Shooter (Crysis 2)

Best visuals (Crysis Warhead)

2008

Best Graphics (Crysis, Crysis Warhead)*

Best Studio

Best German PC Game (Crysis)

Best Game Design (Crysis)

Game of the Year (Crysis)*

2007

Editor's Choice (Crysis)*

Best Graphics (Crysis)*

Best Game (Crysis)

Game of the Year (Crysis)

Best PC Game E3 (Crysis)

2006

Best Graphics E3 (Crysis)*

Best Shooter E3 (Crysis)*

Best FPS (Crysis)

2005

Best New Studio

2004

Best Independent Developer

Best PC Game (Far Cry)

Best In-Game Graphics (Far Cry)

Best Level Design (Far Cry)

Best New IP (Far Cry)

2003

Top Ten Best PC Game E3 (Far Cry)

Best PC Game (Far Cry)

*-won multiple times.
